item.title: Leaking Jupyter instance auth token chaining CVE-2023-39968, CVE-2024-22421 and a chromium bug
item.author: Author
item.description: After getting an invitation to Jupyter’s private (then public and now not active anymore) program on Intigriti I decided to dig into its codebase. Spending a few hours I found a client side path traversal issue chaining which with an open redirect and a chromium issue, I was able to leak Jupyterlab’s authentication and csrf tokens.

item.title: Express notes - "OFFZONE" express file upload challenge
item.author: Author
item.description: The next challenge we did with Varik Matevosyan on OFFZONE Moscow CTF was an express.js file upload application - Express Notes.

item.title: Delicious and Point - "OFFZONE" prototype pollution challenge
item.author: Author
item.description: OFFZONE Moscow team made a great challenge on prototype pollution and we with my friend Varik Matevosyan had a fun time finding gadgets for it.

item.title: BabyPython - "1 CAT COMPANY CTF" crypto and deserialization challenge
item.author: Author
item.description: On the 1 CAT COMPANY CTF we didn’t manage to finalize our solution for the BabyPython challenge, created by Vahe Karapetyan, but one of our team members - Varik Matevosyan, solved it anyways after the time was up.

item.title: OrangeSite - "1 CAT COMPANY CTF" spring xxe challenge
item.author: Author
item.description: On November 27 Cyhub Armenia organized a very fun local CTF event - 1 CAT COMPANY CTF and Hayk Andriasyan created an XXE challenge for it.

item.title: From Intigriti challenge to a Vue.js script gadget
item.author: Author
item.description: Intigiriti’s November challenge by IvarsVids was about a Vue.js one-pager that reflected user input with some replacements. After visiting the challenge homepage at https://challenge-1121.intigriti.io/ we quickly notice it reflects s query parameter not escaping HTML less than and greater than signs resulting in HTML injection.

item.title: Intigriti's February XSS Challenge Writeup
item.author: Author
item.description: This month’s challenge, made by Holme, was a little bit different than the ones I have previously solved as it had a server-side processing issue.

item.title: Intigriti's December XSS Challenge Writeup
item.author: Author
item.description: This month’s Intigriti’s XSS challenge was interesting as it was the first time I saw it had unintentded solutions as well.
